result.execSummary:
The defendant William Edwardo Roldan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, unless sample has been previously taken.

Should defendant get revoked and be sent to prison, Court ordered monies taken from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.

miscConds.notes:
PROBATION CONDITIONS (and extended supervision, if revoked):
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling. Parenting classes/counseling.

No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for his mental or physical needs; take for as long as deemed medically necessary. No alcohol; urine screens.  No contact with Jennifer C. or Ciria H.  No contact with the Subway restaurant located at 725 West Layton Blvd., in the city and county of Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
Seek and maintain employment. Be given job and vocational training.
Pay restitution to Jennifer C. in the stipulated amount of $22.50 and to Ciria H. in the stipulated amount of $30.62 -  before all court costs.

Court ordered defendant to pay the DNA surcharge, plus costs and assessments.  Should defendant get revoked and be sent to prison, Court ordered monies taken from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges for work, if employed. Court would allow good time.

Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, filed. rn
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant William Edwardo Roldan in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant William Edwardo Roldan in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.   Plea hearing proceeds.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Case is continued before Branch 20 for sentencing on 5/09/14 at 1:30 p.m.

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, defendant William Edwardo Roldan not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 20.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William Edwardo Roldan in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant William Edwardo Roldan in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Subway Sandwich Shop at 725 S Layton Blvd.; Jennifer C.; Ciria H. or Jabril P

Defendant William Edwardo Roldan in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant William Edwardo Roldan in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
